properties.value: The forest thins out here a bit. To the north you can see the entrance to a cave through the bushes. There is also a trap door barely visible in the grass.
The forest thins out here a bit. To the north you can see the entrance to a cave through the bushes.
This is a dark and slightly damp cave. You can barely see anything except the light coming from the opening to the south.
A device used for tunneling into new areas. Only usable by programmers or builders. To use it, type 'go <direction> with tunneler'.

verbs.name: go
verbs.code:
if not (player.programmer or player.builder)
  throw new Error "You're not allowed to use the tunneler"

direction = dobjstr
if not direction
  throw new Error "Invalid direction"

if player.location.exits[direction]?
  throw new Error "That direction already exists!"

player.tell "Going #{direction} #{prepstr} the tunneler!"

connectTo = (room) ->
  exit = $('#exit').create direction
  exit.destination = room
  
  player.location.exits[direction] = exit

  exit.invoke()

player.input "Connect to an {magenta|existing} room or a {magenta|new} room?", (response) ->
  switch response
    when 'existing'
      player.input "ID of existing room:", (id) ->
        if (room = $(id)) # TODO check if room is descendant of room class?
          connectTo room
        else
          throw new Error "Couldn't find room with id '#{id}'"
    when 'new'
      player.input "Give me a name for the new room:", (name) ->
        player.input "Descripe the new room:", (description) ->
          newRoom = $('#room').create name
          newRoom.description = description
          connectTo newRoom
    else
      player.tell "{red|Unknown response. Was expecting either 'existing' or 'new'}"

properties.value: A small cell in what appears to be a dungeon. There are 3 stone walls and metal bars to the west. The bars have a door built into them. A ladder on the north wall goes up to a trap door.
You are nowhere. For real. Maybe you should go somewhere?

verbs.name: invoke
verbs.code: player.tell 'The door is locked.'

verbs.name: blink
verbs.code: @location.announce? "The blinker flashes {bold|bright white light} in all directions! You are momentarily blinded."

verbs.name: server_started
verbs.code: # TODO

verbs.name: player_created
verbs.code:
player.parent = $ '#player'
$('#sys').player_connected()

verbs.name: player_connected
verbs.code:
player.location = $ '#6'
player.tell "{blue bold|Welcome, #{player.name}!}"
player.location.player_connected?()

verbs.name: player_disconnected
verbs.code:
player.location.player_disconnected?()
player.location = null

verbs.name: tell
i*nventory
l*ook
verbs.code:
output = ["{yellow bold|#{player.location.name}}"]
output.push player.location.description
things = (thing for thing in player.location.contents when thing != player)
if things.length > 0
  output.push '{cyan|You see here:}'
  for thing in things
    output.push "{cyan|#{thing.name}}"

player.tell output.join '\n'

verbs.name: say
verbs.code:
msg = "\"{white|#{argstr.trim()}}\""
player.tell "{gray|You say #{msg}}"
player.location.announce "{gray|{#{player.color}|#{player.name}} says #{msg}}"

verbs.name: huh
verbs.code:
handleFailedOrAmbiguous = ->
  if dobj == $('#ambiguous_match')
    objects = $('#util').orjoin match(dobjstr).map (o) -> o.name
    player.tell "{gray|I couldn't tell if you meant #{objects}.}"
  else if iobj == $('#ambiguous_match')
    objects = $('#util').orjoin match(iobjstr).map (o) -> o.name
    player.tell "{gray|I couldn't tell if you meant #{objects}.}"
  else if dobj == $('#failed_match')
    player.tell "{gray|I don't see any #{dobjstr} here.}"
  else if iobj == $('#failed_match')
    player.tell "{gray|I don't see any #{iobjstr} here.}"
  else
    player.tell "{gray|I didn't understand that.}"

matches = (direction for direction of player.location.exits).filter (direction) ->
  direction.indexOf(verb) == 0

switch matches.length
  when 0
    handleFailedOrAmbiguous()
  when 1
    player.location.exits[matches[0]].invoke()
  else
    directions = $('#util').orjoin matches
    player.tell "Did you mean #{directions}?"

verbs.name: player_connected
verbs.code:
player.location.look()
player.location.announce "#{player.name} pops into existence."

verbs.name: player_disconnected
verbs.code: player.location.announce "#{player.name} fades away."

verbs.name: go
verbs.code:
matched_exits = (name for name, exit of player.location.exits when argstr == name)
switch matched_exits.length
  when 0
    player.tell "You can't go #{argstr}."
  when 1
    portal = player.location.exits[matched_exits[0]]
    retreats = (retreat for retreat, exit of portal.destination.exits when exit.destination == player.location)
    switch retreats.length
      when 0
        player.bearings = []
      else
        player.bearings = retreats
    portal.invoke()
  else
    directions = $('#util').orjoin matched_exits
    player.tell "Did you mean #{directions}?"

verbs.name: player_left
verbs.code:
[direction] = args
player.tell "You go #{direction}."
player.location.announce "#{player.name} goes #{direction}."

verbs.name: player_arrived
verbs.code:
player.location.look()
player.location.announce "#{player.name} arrives."

verbs.name: emote
verbs.code:
msg = ['{bold magenta|*}', player.name, argstr.trim()].join ' '
player.tell msg
player.location.announce msg

verbs.name: announce
verbs.code:
[msg] = args

for obj in @contents
  if obj != player
    obj.tell?(msg)

verbs.name: help
verbs.code: player.tell "Basic commands: look, say [anything], examine [object], get [object], drop [object], inventory, help"

verbs.name: ex*amine
verbs.code:
msg = []
msg.push "#{@name}:"
msg.push @description
available_actions = $('#util').orjoin (key for key, value of @ when value.verb and not value.hidden)
msg.push "Available actions: #{available_actions}"
player.tell msg.join '\n'

verbs.name: g*et t*ake gr*ab
verbs.code:
if @location == player
  player.tell "You're already holding the #{@name}."
else
  @location = player
  player.tell "You pick up the #{@name}."
  player.location.announce "#{player.name} picks up the #{@name}."

verbs.name: d*rop
verbs.code:
if @location == player
  @location = player.location
  player.tell "You drop the #{@name}."
  player.location.announce "#{player.name} drops the #{@name}."
else
  player.tell "You're not holding the #{@name}."

verbs.name: invoke
verbs.code:
direction = @name
destination = @destination

player.location.player_left?(direction)

player.location = destination

destination.player_arrived?()

verbs.name: orjoin
verbs.code:
a = args[0]
a[0..a.length-2].join(', ') + ' or ' + a[a.length-1]

verbs.name: sw*ing
verbs.code:
if @location == player
  player.tell "You swing the #{@name} around. You look a bit silly."
  player.location.announce "#{player.name} swings a wooden sword around."
else
  player.tell "You're not holding the sword."
